column5: Long-time lurker, first time poster. I'm packed up and ready to head north for lake trout soon as the ice is out - Cliff is on my usual list. Maybe this is the year I can figure them out. Please keep us posted on ice conditions up there - I can't wait! Denny
Ice is still good and will be for some time yet.Temps warming so now melting will be faster.Lake trout are not hard to catch.
I usually have some earlier arrivals come up hoping to get a couple of days of trout fishing on Cliff before walleye opens and some early smallmouth as well.Spring tends to have some trout shallow.

PROV1800 - I'll admit I pretty inexperienced, but I have not had very good luck with trout on Cliff. BTW, I think I met you coming of Cliff years ago at the 105 landing - you took one look at the canoe on top of my truck and graciously suggested a more sheltered landing, which I've used mutliple times since. If that was you, thanks for the good advice. Denny

Have met a number of people at hwy landing and somewhat remember a canoe in the conversation.If I was in a white lund it was probably me.If I suggested the Deer Lake Rd to launch on and you did that glad we talked.
Yep, Deer Lake Rd it was. If you see a little old guy bobbing around in a Grumman sportboat in a few weeks, it will likely be me. Thanks for the good advice. Denny
Hope I see you Denny.I will be out there a few times.
I don't know if this is true or not.But the department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada wants all ice fishing houses off the lake by July 2nd.
